original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/2/19: (Ps. 27:1-8)The Lord is my light and
salvation--whom shall I fear? The Lord is stronghold of my life--of
whomshall I be afraid? (Ps. 27:1)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Jesus
understands our fears and problems, so whenwe describe our struggles
to Him, He doesn't brush us aside, He doesn't minimize our feelings,or
tell us to snap out of it, He relates to our distress.Somehow, knowing
that He understand can dispelthe loneliness that often accompanies
suffering.IN OUR DARKEST TIMES, HE IS OUR LIGHT AND OUR SALVATION.
PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: Jesus understands our fears and problems, so when we describe our struggles to Him, He doesn't brush us aside, He doesn't minimize our feelings,or tell us to snap out of it, He relates to our distress.Somehow, knowing that He understand can dispelthe loneliness that often accompanies suffering. IN OUR DARKEST TIMES, HE IS OUR LIGHT AND OUR SALVATION.
original_verse_text: The Lord is my light and salvation whom shall I fear? The Lord is stronghold of my life of whom shall I be afraid?
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in our moments of fear and distress, for You are our light and our salvation. When the shadows of this world threaten to overwhelm us, we find refuge in Your unwavering presence. Lord, grant us the courage to trust in Your steadfast love, even when the path ahead seems uncertain. May Your Spirit guide us, and may the knowledge of Your understanding comfort our souls. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Jesus understands our fears and problems, so when we describe our struggles to Him, He doesn't brush us aside, He doesn't minimize our feelings, or tell us to snap out of it. He relates to our distress. Somehow, knowing that He understands can dispel the loneliness that often accompanies suffering. In our darkest times, He is our light and our salvation.
subject: He Understands
verse_text: The Lord is my light and salvation whom shall I fear? The Lord is stronghold of my life of whom shall I be afraid?

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/3/19: (Ps. 29)
The Lord gives strength to His people; The Lord blesses Hispeople
with peace. (Ps. 29:11)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Are you facing a
difficulty--the lose of a loved one--a severe physical or emotional
crises? turn it over to God. You'll havemany trying days, BUT He'll
give you the strength to go on andHis peace to comfort your soul.
Claim the double promise of(Ps. 29:11) as your own. THE SECRET OF
PEACE IS TO GIVE ALLYOUR ANXIETIES TO GOD. PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: Are you facing a difficulty--the lose of a loved one--a severe physical or emotional crises? turn it over to God. You'll havemany trying days, BUT He'll give you the strength to go on andHis peace to comfort your soul. Claim the double promise of (Psalm 29:11) as your own. THE SECRET OF PEACE IS TO GIVE ALLYOUR ANXIETIES TO GOD.
original_verse_text: The Lord gives strength to His people; The Lord blesses His people with peace.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You in this time of trial and difficulty, seeking Your strength and peace. As we face the loss of a loved one or other severe crises, we cling to the promise of Psalm 29:11, that You will give us the strength to endure and the peace to comfort our souls. Lord, we surrender our anxieties to You, trusting in Your unfailing love and care. Grant us the courage to walk through each day, sustained by Your mighty power. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Are you facing a difficulty—the loss of a loved one—a severe physical or emotional crisis? Turn it over to God. You'll have many trying days, but He'll give you the strength to go on and His peace to comfort your soul. Claim the double promise of (Psalm 29:11) as your own. The secret of peace is to give all your anxieties to God.
subject: A Double Promise
verse_text: The Lord gives strength to His people; The Lord blesses His people with peace.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/4/19: (Ps. 122:6-9) READ (2 Chron. 7:16)I urge . .
that petitions, prayers, intercession and be made for all people. (I
Tim. 2:1)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:The Bible reveals that God intervenes in
the affairs of nations (2 Chron. 7:14). And when God intervenes He
uses ordinary people. It is up to us to do that through prayer. As the
psalmist urged the ancient Israelites to pray for the peace and
healing of Jerusalem, so we should also pray for the peace and healing
of our nations. When we pray in humility, turn from our sins, and seek
God, He hears us. PRAYER FOR THOSE IN AUTHORITY IS BOTH A PRIVILEGE
AND A DUTY. PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: The Bible reveals that God intervenes in the affairs of nations (2 Chronicles 7:14). And when God intervenes He uses ordinary people. It is up to us to do that through prayer. As the psalmist urged the ancient Israelites to pray for the peace and healing of Jerusalem, so we should also pray for the peace and healing of our nations. When we pray in humility, turn from our sins, and seek God, He hears us. PRAYER FOR THOSE IN AUTHORITY IS BOTH A PRIVILEGE AND A DUTY.
original_verse_text: I urge that petitions, prayers, intercession and be made for all people.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, recognizing Your sovereign power over the nations. As Your Word instructs, we lift up our prayers for the peace and healing of our land. May those in authority seek Your wisdom and guidance, that they may lead with righteousness and justice. Forgive us for our sins, and help us to turn to You with all our hearts, that You may hear our prayers and restore our nations. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: The Bible reveals that God intervenes in the affairs of nations (2 Chronicles 7:14). And when God intervenes, He uses ordinary people. It is up to us to do that through prayer. As the psalmist urged the ancient Israelites to pray for the peace and healing of Jerusalem, so we should also pray for the peace and healing of our nations. When we pray in humility, turn from our sins, and seek God, He hears us. Prayer for those in authority is both a privilege and a duty.
subject: Pray for Our Nation
verse_text: I urge that petitions, prayers, intercession and be made for all people.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/6/19:Turn Your ear to me, come quickly to my rescue; be
my rock and refuge,a strong fortress to save me. Since You are my
rock and my fortress, forthe sake of Your name lead and guide me
(Ps. 31:2-3)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Protection comes in many forms. Where
does a believer hide whensurrounded by danger? David has the answer in
Psalm 31. Rememberwhen he wrote this psalm things were not going well
for him. He was in a vulnerable position, BUT he was not defenseless.
David had a refuge. He knew that God is the best possible source of
safety and that the wisest defense strategy is to have a right
relationship with God. David calledupon the name of God. Are we as
wise? Are we as quick to seek thatsame security? HE WHO WAS A SURE
HIDING PLACE FOR DAVID IS ALSO THEONE WE SHOULD CLING TO FOR
PROTECTION. PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: Protection comes in many forms. Where does a believer hide whensurrounded by danger? David has the answer in Psalm 31. Rememberwhen he wrote this psalm things were not going well for him. He was in a vulnerable position, BUT he was not defenseless. David had a refuge. He knew that God is the best possible source of safety and that the wisest defense strategy is to have a right relationship with God. David calledupon the name of God. Are we as wise? Are we as quick to seek that same security? HE WHO WAS A SURE HIDING PLACE FOR DAVID IS ALSO THEONE WE SHOULD CLING TO FOR PROTECTION.
original_verse_text: Turn Your ear to me, come quickly to my rescue; be my rock and refuge,a strong fortress to save me. Since You are my rock and my fortress, forthe sake of Your name lead and guide me.
prayer: Heavenly Father, in times of trouble and distress, we turn to You as our refuge and strength. Like David, we seek shelter under the shadow of Your wings, for You alone are our rock, our fortress, and our deliverer. When the storms of life threaten to overwhelm us, help us to remember that our ultimate security rests in You. Guide us, Lord, that we may walk in Your ways and find safety in Your presence. Amen.
reflection: Protection comes in many forms. Where does a believer hide whensurrounded by danger? David has the answer in Psalm 31. Rememberwhen he wrote this psalm things were not going well for him. He was in a vulnerable position, BUT he was not defenseless. David had a refuge. He knew that God is the best possible source of safety and that the wisest defense strategy is to have a right relationship with God. David calledupon the name of God. Are we as wise? Are we as quick to seek that same security? HE WHO WAS A SURE HIDING PLACE FOR DAVID IS ALSO THEONE WE SHOULD CLING TO FOR PROTECTION.
subject: David's Hiding Place
verse_text: Turn Your ear to me, come quickly to my rescue; be my rock and refuge,a strong fortress to save me. Since You are my rock and my fortress, forthe sake of Your name lead and guide me.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/7/19:I will instruct you and guide you in the way you 
should go;I will counsel you with My loving eyes on you. (Ps.
32:8)THOUGHT FOR TODAY: We all face storms that threaten to confuse
and disorient us. It may be a doctor's office, a friend who has
betrayed you, or a shattered dream. Those are the times to be
especially careful.When you are blinded by life's disappointment,
don't trust yourinstincts. Go to your Bible and trust God to guide
you. Hepromised "I WILL INSTRUCT YOU AND TEACH YOU IN THE WAY YOU
SHOULD GO." (Ps. 32:8)THE CLOSER WE WALK WITH GOD, THE CLEARED WE
WILL SE HIS GUIDANCE. PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: We all face storms that threaten to confuse and disorient us. It may be a doctor's office, a friend who has betrayed you, or a shattered dream. Those are the times to be especially careful.When you are blinded by life's disappointment, don't trust yourinstincts. Go to your Bible and trust God to guide you. Hepromised "I WILL INSTRUCT YOU AND TEACH YOU IN THE WAY YOU SHOULD GO." (Psalm 32:8)THE CLOSER WE WALK WITH GOD, THE CLEARED WE WILL SE HIS GUIDANCE.
original_verse_text: I will instruct you and guide you in the way you should go; I will counsel you with My loving eyes on you.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in the midst of life's storms, when confusion and disorientation threaten to overwhelm us. In these times of disappointment and uncertainty, we cling to Your promise to instruct and teach us in the way we should go. Lord, help us to trust in Your guidance and not our own instincts. Draw us closer to You, that we may see Your path more clearly. We surrender our lives to You, our ever-present Counselor. Amen.
reflection: We all face storms that threaten to confuse and disorient us. It may be a doctor's office, a friend who has betrayed you, or a shattered dream. Those are the times to be especially careful. When you are blinded by life's disappointment, don't trust your instincts. Go to your Bible and trust God to guide you. He promised, “I WILL INSTRUCT YOU AND TEACH YOU IN THE WAY YOU SHOULD GO.” (Psalm 32:8) THE CLOSER WE WALK WITH GOD, THE CLEARER WE WILL SEE HIS GUIDANCE.
subject: Trust the Creator's Guidance
verse_text: I will instruct you and guide you in the way you should go; I will counsel you with My loving eyes on you.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/8/19:Sing joyfully to the Lord, you righteous, it is
fitting for the upright to praise Him. Sing to Him a new
song. (Ps. 33:1, 3,)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Why should we sing? IS IT
ONLY to prepare worshipers for the sermon? Paul would have frowned on
such an idea BECAUSE he was convinced that the gospel alone,
truthfully proclaimed, is  (The power of God that brings
salvation. (Ro. 1:16) No we sing because it is a great way to
express our adoration and proclaim our faith. So let us join
enthusiastically with others in praising God through song. THE LORD IS
PLEASED WITH ANY MELODY OF PRAISE THAT COMES FROM THE HEART. PASTOR
AL
original_reflection_text: Why should we sing? IS IT ONLY to prepare worshipers for the sermon? Paul would have frowned on such an idea BECAUSE he was convinced that the gospel alone, truthfully proclaimed, is (The power of God that brings salvation. (Romans 1:16) No we sing because it is a great way to express our adoration and proclaim our faith. So let us join enthusiastically with others in praising God through song. THE LORD IS PLEASED WITH ANY MELODY OF PRAISE THAT COMES FROM THE HEART.
original_verse_text: Sing joyfully to the Lord, you righteous, it is fitting for the upright to praise Him. Sing to Him a new song.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with joyful hearts, ready to lift our voices in songs of praise. Your Word calls us to sing with gladness, for You are worthy of our adoration. May our melodies reflect the truth of Your gospel, the power that brings salvation to all who believe. Let our praises flow freely, for You are pleased with any sincere expression of worship that comes from the depths of our souls. We exalt Your name, O Lord, and give thanks for Your steadfast love and faithfulness. Amen.
reflection: Why should we sing? Is it only to prepare worshipers for the sermon? Paul would have frowned on such an idea because he was convinced that the gospel alone, truthfully proclaimed, is the power of God that brings salvation. (Romans 1:16) No, we sing because it is a great way to express our adoration and proclaim our faith. So let us join enthusiastically with others in praising God through song. The Lord is pleased with any melody of praise that comes from the heart.
subject: Let's Sing
verse_text: Sing joyfully to the Lord, you righteous, it is fitting for the upright to praise Him. Sing to Him a new song.

original_content: VERSE FOR 7/9/19: I sought the Lord, and He answered me; He delivered me from all my fears. (Ps. 34:4) THOUGHT FOR TODAY: Fears have away of sneaking into our heart without permission. WHEN fears and worries strike, we need to read David's prayer in Psalm 34:4. How does God deliver us from our fears? When we look to Him (vs. 5) and when we focus on Him our fears fade; and we trust Him to be in control. David's awe of the Lord's goodness helps us put our fears into perspective. When we remember who God is and how much He loves us, we can relax into His peace. IN (VS. 9) David concludes: Those who fear Him lack nothing, HOW WONDERFUL TO DISCOVER THAT IN THE FEAR OF THE LORD WE CAN BE DELIVERED FROM OUR FEARS. PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: Fears have away of sneaking into our heart without permission. WHEN fears and worries strike, we need to read David's prayer in Psalm 34:4. How does God deliver us from our fears? When we look to Him (vs. 5) and when we focus on Him our fears fade; and we trust Him to be in control. David's awe of the Lord's goodness helps us put our fears into perspective. When we remember who God is and how much He loves us, we can relax into His peace. IN (VS. 9) David concludes: Those who fear Him lack nothing, HOW WONDERFUL TO DISCOVER THAT IN THE FEAR OF THE LORD WE CAN BE DELIVERED FROM OUR FEARS.
original_verse_text: I sought the Lord, and He answered me; He delivered me from all my fears.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with our fears and worries that so often creep into our hearts. Help us to look to You and focus on Your goodness, as David did in Psalm 34. May we trust in Your sovereign control and find peace in the fear of the Lord, for those who fear You lack nothing. Deliver us from our fears, O Lord, and fill us with Your perfect love. Amen.
reflection: Fears have away of sneaking into our heart without permission. WHEN fears and worries strike, we need to read David's prayer in Psalm 34:4. How does God deliver us from our fears? When we look to Him (vs. 5) and when we focus on Him our fears fade; and we trust Him to be in control. David's awe of the Lord's goodness helps us put our fears into perspective. When we remember who God is and how much He loves us, we can relax into His peace. IN (VS. 9) David concludes: Those who fear Him lack nothing, HOW WONDERFUL TO DISCOVER THAT IN THE FEAR OF THE LORD WE CAN BE DELIVERED FROM OUR FEARS.
subject: Free from Fears
verse_text: I sought the Lord, and He answered me; He delivered me from all my fears.

original_content:
VERSE FOR7/10/19:

Contend, Lord, with those who contend with me; 

fight against those who fight against me. (Ps. 35:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Have you found yourself in an environment that is

not friendly to godliness? If so what can you do?

Here are some suggestions that may help you survive

and even thrive.

Concentrate on God goodness and depend on it. (Nah.1:7)

Stay true to your convictions. (Dan. 1)

Immerse yourself in the Bible. (Ps. 119:49-50)

Do good to those who oppose you (Mt. 5:44)

Trust God to be your companion. (Heb. 13:5)

WITH GOD BEHIND YOU AND HIS ARM BENEATH YOU,

YOU CAN FACE WHATEVER IS BEFORE YOU.

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: Have you found yourself in an environment that is not friendly to godliness? If so what can you do? Here are some suggestions that may help you survive and even thrive. Concentrate on God goodness and depend on it. (Nahum 1:7) Stay true to your convictions. (Daniel 1) Immerse yourself in the Bible. (Psalm 119:49-50) Do good to those who oppose you (Matthew 5:44) Trust God to be your companion. (Hebrews 13:5) WITH GOD BEHIND YOU AND HIS ARM BENEATH YOU, YOU CAN FACE WHATEVER IS BEFORE YOU.
original_verse_text: Contend, Lord, with those who contend with me; fight against those who fight against me.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You in this challenging environment, seeking Your strength and guidance. Help us to concentrate on Your goodness and depend on Your unfailing love, as described in Nahum 1:7. Grant us the courage to stay true to our convictions, like Daniel, and to immerse ourselves in Your Word, as the psalmist did in Psalm 119. Enable us to do good to those who oppose us, following the example of Jesus in Matthew 5:44. Lord, we trust that with You behind us and Your arm beneath us, we can face whatever is before us. Amen.
reflection: Have you found yourself in an environment that is not friendly to godliness? If so what can you do? Here are some suggestions that may help you survive and even thrive. Concentrate on God goodness and depend on it. (Nahum 1:7) Stay true to your convictions. (Daniel 1) Immerse yourself in the Bible. (Psalm 119:49-50) Do good to those who oppose you (Matthew 5:44) Trust God to be your companion. (Hebrews 13:5) WITH GOD BEHIND YOU AND HIS ARM BENEATH YOU, YOU CAN FACE WHATEVER IS BEFORE YOU.
subject: Just You and God
verse_text: Contend, Lord, with those who contend with me; fight against those who fight against me.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/11/19:

They feast on the abundance of your house; you give them drink from
your river of delights. (Ps. 36:8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Sometimes we may feel that all the demands of life have depleted our
strength and there is no one to replenish it. Others cannot replenish
it, but God can. In Ps. 36 we read about God's lovingkindness. It
describes those who put their trust in Him and are abundantly
satisfied. God gives them water from His river of delight (vs.
8). He is the fountain of life. We can go to God every day to supply
of our needs. Let us be filled with His abundant supply, His fountain
will never run dry,

GOD'S LOVE IS ABUNDANT.

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: Sometimes we may feel that all the demands of life have depleted our strength and there is no one to replenish it. Others cannot replenish it, but God can. In Psalm 36 we read about God's lovingkindness. It describes those who put their trust in Him and are abundantly satisfied. God gives them water from His river of delight (vs. 8). He is the fountain of life. We can go to God every day to supply of our needs. Let us be filled with His abundant supply, His fountain will never run dry, GOD'S LOVE IS ABUNDANT.
original_verse_text: They feast on the abundance of your house; you give them drink from your river of delights.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You, the fountain of life, seeking to be filled with Your abundant love and delight. In the midst of the demands and challenges of this world, we find our strength replenished in Your presence. Your loving-kindness is our refuge, and in the river of Your delights, we are abundantly satisfied. Lord, may we ever trust in You, the source of all life and joy. Amen.
reflection: Sometimes we may feel that all the demands of life have depleted our strength and there is no one to replenish it. Others cannot replenish it, but God can. In Psalm 36 we read about God's lovingkindness. It describes those who put their trust in Him and are abundantly satisfied. God gives them water from His river of delight (vs. 8). He is the fountain of life. We can go to God every day to supply our needs. Let us be filled with His abundant supply, His fountain will never run dry. God's love is abundant.
subject: Abundant Supply
verse_text: They feast on the abundance of your house; you give them drink from your river of delights.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/12/19:

Trust in the Lord and do good; dwell in the land and enjoy safe
pasture. 

Be still before the Lord and wait patiently for Him; do not fret
when people 

Succeed in their ways, when they carry out their wicked schemes.
(Ps. 33:3, 7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Patient perseverance should characterize the life of every believer.

In Ps. 37 God is saying, in effect, "Do what is right and trust Me.

Regardless of how badly you may seem to be losing, do My will and

leave the outcome to Me." Such a strategy will not only keep us
from

beating ourselves but it will also lead to victory. GOD'S CLOCK IS
NEVER

SLOW, BUT SOMETIMES OURS IS FAST! ! !

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: Patient perseverance should characterize the life of every believer. In Psalm 37 God is saying, in effect, "Do what is right and trust Me. Regardless of how badly you may seem to be losing, do My will and leave the outcome to Me." Such a strategy will not only keep us from beating ourselves but it will also lead to victory. GOD'S CLOCK IS NEVER SLOW, BUT SOMETIMES OURS IS FAST! ! !
original_verse_text: Trust in the Lord and do good; dwell in the land and enjoy safe pasture. Be still before the Lord and wait patiently for Him; do not fret when people Succeed in their ways, when they carry out their wicked schemes.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts that long to walk in Your ways and trust in Your perfect timing. Help us to resist the temptation to fret or be envious of those who seem to prosper, for we know that Your plan is always good and Your timing is never slow. Grant us the patience and perseverance to do what is right, leaving the outcome in Your sovereign hands. May we find our delight in You, resting in the assurance that You will uphold the righteous and bring about Your purposes in Your time. Amen.
reflection: Patient perseverance should characterize the life of every believer. In Psalm 37, God is saying, in effect, “Do what is right and trust Me. Regardless of how badly you may seem to be losing, do My will and leave the outcome to Me.” Such a strategy will not only keep us from beating ourselves but it will also lead to victory. God's clock is never slow, but sometimes ours is fast.
subject: Strategy for Patience
verse_text: Trust in the Lord and do good; dwell in the land and enjoy safe pasture. Be still before the Lord and wait patiently for Him; do not fret when people Succeed in their ways, when they carry out their wicked schemes.

original_content:
Yesterday there was a typ-o the text came from Ps. 37:3, 7 not 33:3,
7

VERSE FOR 7/13/19. .

Lord, I wait for You; You will answer, Lord my God. (Ps. 38:15)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

If you read the first 15 vs. of Ps. 38 you will notice that David
poured

out his struggles and complaint to God. The answer for our
destructive

foolishness is to grasp the wisdom of God. (PRO. 9:10) reminds us,

"The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, AND knowledge
of the 

Holy One is understanding." Only by allowing God to transform us
can

we overcome the foolish decisions that cause us so much trouble. WITH

HIS lOVING GUIDANCE, WE CAN FOLLOW THE PATHWAY OF GODLY WISDOM.

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: If you read the first 15 vs. of Psalm 38 you will notice that David poured out his struggles and complaint to God. The answer for our destructive foolishness is to grasp the wisdom of God. (PRO. 9:10) reminds us, "The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, AND knowledge of the Holy One is understanding." Only by allowing God to transform us can we overcome the foolish decisions that cause us so much trouble. WITH HIS LOVING GUIDANCE, WE CAN FOLLOW THE PATHWAY OF GODLY WISDOM.
original_verse_text: Lord, I wait for You; You will answer, Lord my God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You acknowledging our foolish decisions that have caused us so much trouble. We confess that the fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and that knowledge of the Holy One is true understanding. Lord, guide us with Your loving wisdom, that we may walk the pathway of godly wisdom and overcome the destructive consequences of our foolishness. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: If you read the first 15 verses of Psalm 38, you will notice that David poured out his struggles and complaint to God. The answer for our destructive foolishness is to grasp the wisdom of God. (Proverbs 9:10) reminds us, “The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.” Only by allowing God to transform us can we overcome the foolish decisions that cause us so much trouble. With His loving guidance, we can follow the pathway of godly wisdom.
subject: The Path to Wisdom
verse_text: Lord, I wait for You; You will answer, Lord my God.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/14/19:

For His anger lasts only for a moment, but His favor lasts

a lifetime: weeping may stay for the night, but rejoicing

comes in the morning. (Ps. 30:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Have you experienced extreme sorrow? There is a promise

of future joy amid your tears as you lean upon our loving

Lord. YOU CAN LEAVE YOUR SORROWS WITH JESUS THE "MAN OF

SORROWS."

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: Have you experienced extreme sorrow? There is a promise of future joy amid your tears as you lean upon our loving Lord. YOU CAN LEAVE YOUR SORROWS WITH JESUS THE MAN OF SORROWS.
original_verse_text: For His anger lasts only for a moment, but His favor lasts a lifetime: weeping may stay for the night, but rejoicing comes in the morning.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in our times of deepest sorrow, knowing that You are a God who hears our cries and lifts us from the pit of despair. As we meditate on the words of Psalm 40, we are reminded that even in the darkest of nights, Your steadfast love and faithfulness are ever-present. Lord, we trust that though weeping may tarry for the night, Your joy will come in the morning. Help us to cast our burdens upon You, the Man of Sorrows who understands our pain. In Your loving embrace, may we find the strength to persevere and the hope that sustains us. Amen.
reflection: Have you experienced extreme sorrow? There is a promise of future joy amid your tears as you lean upon our loving Lord. You can leave your sorrows with Jesus, the Man of Sorrows.
subject: Joy in the Morning
verse_text: For His anger lasts only for a moment, but His favor lasts a lifetime: weeping may stay for the night, but rejoicing comes in the morning.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/16/19

My heart is stirred by a noble theme as I recite my verses

for the king; my tongue is the pen of a skillful writer. (Ps.
45:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Our one tongue has a lot more potential than most of us will

ever put to use. A tongue devoted to God can accomplish much.

Have you ever become discouraged, thinking that you have little

to offer God? If you have Christ's love in your heart and a willing

tongue in your mouth, you can offer them boldly to God today

and begin to bring praise and honor to the lord.

REMEMBER THAT LITTLE IS MUCH WHEN GOD IS IN IT!

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: Our one tongue has a lot more potential than most of us will ever put to use. A tongue devoted to God can accomplish much. Have you ever become discouraged, thinking that you have little to offer God? If you have Christ's love in your heart and a willing tongue in your mouth, you can offer them boldly to God today and begin to bring praise and honor to the lord. REMEMBER THAT LITTLE IS MUCH WHEN GOD IS IN IT!
original_verse_text: My heart is stirred by a noble theme as I recite my verses for the king; my tongue is the pen of a skillful writer.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts overflowing with gratitude for the gift of speech. May our tongues be instruments of Your praise, proclaiming the wonders of Your majesty and the riches of Your love. Let our words be a reflection of the abundance You have placed within us, that we may honor and glorify Your name. Though we may feel small and insignificant, we trust that when our hearts are devoted to You, our offerings become much in Your sight. Amen.
reflection: Our one tongue has a lot more potential than most of us will ever put to use. A tongue devoted to God can accomplish much. Have you ever become discouraged, thinking that you have little to offer God? If you have Christ's love in your heart and a willing tongue in your mouth, you can offer them boldly to God today and begin to bring praise and honor to the Lord. Remember that little is much when God is in it!
subject: One Tongue is Enough
verse_text: My heart is stirred by a noble theme as I recite my verses for the king; my tongue is the pen of a skillful writer.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/17/19:

The Lord is a refuge for the oppressed, a stronghold

In times of trouble. (Ps. 9:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When we experience tragedy, we may wonder about God's

goodness. Is God always good? YES, He is! He DOESN'T promise

that bad things will never happen to us, but He DOES promise

to be "our refuge and strength." (Ps. 46:1). He DOESN'T
promise

that we will NEVER walk through heart-wrenching circumstances,

BUT he promises that we won't be alone (Ps. 23:4). God is good--

no matter what suffering we are experiencing. EVEN WHEN we

don't understand, we can say with Habakkuk, "Yet I will rejoice

in the Lord, I will be joyful in God my Savior." (Hab. 3:18).

GOD TESTS OUR FAITH SO WE MAY TRUST HIS FAITHFULNESS.

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: When we experience tragedy, we may wonder about God's goodness. Is God always good? YES, He is! He DOESN'T promise that bad things will never happen to us, but He DOES promise to be "our refuge and strength." (Psalm 46:1). He DOESN'T promise that we will NEVER walk through heart-wrenching circumstances, BUT he promises that we won't be alone (Psalm 23:4). God is good-- no matter what suffering we are experiencing. EVEN WHEN we don't understand, we can say with Habakkuk, "Yet I will rejoice in the Lord, I will be joyful in God my Savior." (Habakkuk 3:18). GOD TESTS OUR FAITH SO WE MAY TRUST HIS FAITHFULNESS.
original_verse_text: The Lord is a refuge for the oppressed, a stronghold In times of trouble.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in the midst of life's trials and tribulations. Though the storms of this world may rage around us, we find refuge and strength in Your steadfast love. Remind us that even when we do not understand the reasons for our suffering, You are good and faithful. Help us to trust in Your promises and to rejoice in You, our Savior, no matter the circumstances. May our faith be strengthened as we cling to Your unwavering presence. Amen.
reflection: When we experience tragedy, we may wonder about God's goodness. Is God always good? YES, He is! He DOESN'T promise that bad things will never happen to us, but He DOES promise to be “our refuge and strength.” (Psalm 46:1). He DOESN'T promise that we will NEVER walk through heart-wrenching circumstances, BUT he promises that we won't be alone (Psalm 23:4). God is good-- no matter what suffering we are experiencing. EVEN WHEN we don't understand, we can say with Habakkuk, “Yet I will rejoice in the Lord, I will be joyful in God my Savior.” (Habakkuk 3:18). GOD TESTS OUR FAITH SO WE MAY TRUST HIS FAITHFULNESS.
subject: A Good God
verse_text: The Lord is a refuge for the oppressed, a stronghold In times of trouble.

original_content:
THOUGHTFUL PRAISES (read all of Ps. 47)

VERSE FOR 7:18:19:

For God is the King of all the earth: sing to Him a psalm 

of praise. (Ps. 47:7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

I wonder what God thinks about the way we sing in church.

I'm NOT talking about the quality of our voices, BUT the honesty

of our words. Are we being truthful? The following rewritten

hymn titles might more accurately express what is in our hearts

as we sing:

"Just As I Am" IS "Just As I Pretend To Be"

"O How I Love Jesus" BECOMES "O How I Like Jesus"

"He's Everything To Me" MEANS "He's Quiet A Bit To Me"

Jesus said that we are to worship Him in truth. (Jn. 4:24)

LET'S TAKE UP THE CHALLENGE BY SEEKING GOD'S HELP TO MAKE

THE ORIGINAL TITLES OF THESE HYMNS TRUE FOR US.

PASTOR AL

PS. SORRY FOR THE DELAY
original_reflection_text: I wonder what God thinks about the way we sing in church. I'm NOT talking about the quality of our voices, BUT the honesty of our words. Are we being truthful? The following rewritten hymn titles might more accurately express what is in our hearts as we sing: "Just As I Am" IS "Just As I Pretend To Be" "O How I Love Jesus" BECOMES "O How I Like Jesus" "He's Everything To Me" MEANS "He's Quiet A Bit To Me" Jesus said that we are to worship Him in truth. (John 4:24) LET'S TAKE UP THE CHALLENGE BY SEEKING GOD'S HELP TO MAKE THE ORIGINAL TITLES OF THESE HYMNS TRUE FOR US.
original_verse_text: For God is the King of all the earth: sing to Him a psalm of praise.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before you with hearts longing to worship you in truth. Help us to sing with sincerity, not merely with our lips, but with the genuine affection of our souls. May our hymns and songs reflect the depth of our love and devotion to you, the one true God. Empower us by your Spirit to live out the words we sing, that our lives may glorify your name. We ask this in the precious name of Jesus. Amen.
reflection: I wonder what God thinks about the way we sing in church. I'm NOT talking about the quality of our voices, BUT the honesty of our words. Are we being truthful? The following rewritten hymn titles might more accurately express what is in our hearts as we sing: “Just As I Am” IS “Just As I Pretend To Be” “O How I Love Jesus” BECOMES “O How I Like Jesus” “He's Everything To Me” MEANS “He's Quiet A Bit To Me” Jesus said that we are to worship Him in truth. (John 4:24) LET'S TAKE UP THE CHALLENGE BY SEEKING GOD'S HELP TO MAKE THE ORIGINAL TITLES OF THESE HYMNS TRUE FOR US.
subject: Thoughtful Praises
verse_text: For God is the King of all the earth: sing to Him a psalm of praise.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/19/19:

"Holy, Holy, Holy, is the Lord Almighty; the whole earth

is full of His glory." (Isa. 6:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

There are some things God can't do. For example, God CANNOT

tell a lie. He CAN'T do anything that conflicts with His holy

character. Let me explain what this means to us on a practical

level.

His perfect righteousness ASSURES US that we can trust His will

because He will always do what is right. (Gen. 18:25)

His perfect Justice MEANS that God will be unquestionably fair. (2
Cor. 5:10)

His perfect truthfulness ASSURES US that we can take Him at His
word. (Num. 23:19)

His perfect faithfulness TELLS US that He will never let us down.
(Lam. 3:22, 23)

THE HOLINESS OF GOD CONVICTS THE SINNER AND COMFORTS TO SAINT.
(believer)

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: There are some things God can't do. For example, God CANNOT tell a lie. He CAN'T do anything that conflicts with His holy character. Let me explain what this means to us on a practical level. His perfect righteousness ASSURES US that we can trust His will because He will always do what is right. (Genesis 18:25) His perfect Justice MEANS that God will be unquestionably fair. (2 Corinthians 5:10) His perfect truthfulness ASSURES US that we can take Him at His word. (Numbers 23:19) His perfect faithfulness TELLS US that He will never let us down. (Lamentations 3:22, 23) THE HOLINESS OF GOD CONVICTS THE SINNER AND COMFORTS TO SAINT. (believer)
original_verse_text: Holy, Holy, Holy, is the Lord Almighty; the whole earth is full of His glory.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your holiness and perfection. Your righteousness, justice, truthfulness, and faithfulness are beyond measure. We praise You that You cannot lie or act against Your holy character. Your will is always right, Your judgments are always fair, and Your promises are always trustworthy. We find great comfort in the knowledge that we can fully rely on You, our faithful God. May we live in reverence and obedience to Your perfect ways. Amen.
reflection: There are some things God can't do. For example, God CANNOT tell a lie. He CAN'T do anything that conflicts with His holy character. Let me explain what this means to us on a practical level. His perfect righteousness ASSURES US that we can trust His will because He will always do what is right. (Genesis 18:25) His perfect Justice MEANS that God will be unquestionably fair. (2 Corinthians 5:10) His perfect truthfulness ASSURES US that we can take Him at His word. (Numbers 23:19) His perfect faithfulness TELLS US that He will never let us down. (Lamentations 3:22, 23) THE HOLINESS OF GOD CONVICTS THE SINNER AND COMFORTS TO SAINT. (believer)
subject: Holy is the Lord
verse_text: Holy, Holy, Holy, is the Lord Almighty; the whole earth is full of His glory.

original_content:
DEVO. FOR 7/20/19: VERSE FOR TODAY:

Surely God is my help; the Lord is the one who sustains me. (Ps.
54:4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When life has you down---whether through sorrow that seems

to hard to bear OR circumstances that make each day a morning-

to-night grind-let God pull you up by His power (Ps. 54:1-4) says.

Then hold on to His hand. Cling to Him, Eph. 6:10 says:

"Be strong in the Lord and His mighty power." Trust in His

power and hold on. Isa. 49:31 say: HE WILL GIVE YOU THE STRENGTH


TO KEEP YOU FROM FALLING.

PASTOR SATHER'S, FOOD FOR THOUGHT
original_reflection_text: When life has you down—whether due to sorrow that feels too hard to bear or circumstances that make each day a grueling grind—let God lift you up with His power, as stated in Psalm 54:1-4. Hold on to His hand and cling to Him. Ephesians 6:10 encourages us to "be strong in the Lord and in His mighty power." Trust in His strength and hold on. Isaiah 49:31 assures us that He will give you the strength to keep you from falling.
original_verse_text: Surely God is my help; the Lord is the one who sustains me.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in our time of need, seeking Your strength and power to lift us up. When sorrow weighs heavily upon us and circumstances seem overwhelming, we cling to Your promise that You are our helper, our sustainer, and our protector. Lord, we trust in Your mighty power to keep us from falling and to give us the strength to endure. Amen.
reflection: When life has you down—whether due to sorrow that feels too hard to bear or circumstances that make each day a grueling grind—let God lift you up with His power, as stated in Psalm 54:1-4. Hold on to His hand and cling to Him. Ephesians 6:10 encourages us to “be strong in the Lord and in His mighty power.” Trust in His strength and hold on. Isaiah 49:31 assures us that He will give you the strength to keep you from falling.
subject: Need a Lift?
verse_text: Surely God is my help; the Lord is the one who sustains me.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/21/19:

The eternal God is our refuge, and underneath are the 

everlasting arms. (Deut. 33:27)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Once you have begun to walk with God, you need only

to keep waking with Him, and all of life becomes one

long stroll.

As we sense the strength of God's everlasting arms beneath

us, we can stroll though life with confidence, as-long-as we

keep our hand in the hand of our unseen Companion.

We can be confident about tomorrow if we walk with God

today.

PASTOR AL.
original_reflection_text: Once you have begun to walk with God, you need only to keep waking with Him, and all of life becomes one long stroll. As we sense the strength of God's everlasting arms beneath us, we can stroll though life with confidence, as-long-as we keep our hand in the hand of our unseen Companion. We can be confident about tomorrow if we walk with God today.
original_verse_text: The eternal God is our refuge, and underneath are the everlasting arms.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging Your everlasting arms that support us through the journey of life. In times of fear and uncertainty, we find comfort in the truth that You are our refuge and strength, a very present help in times of trouble. Lord, grant us the wisdom to keep our hand in Yours, that we may walk with You each day, confident in Your unfailing love and protection. Guide us, we pray, that we may abide in Your presence and find peace in the shadow of Your wings. Amen.
reflection: Once you have begun to walk with God, you need only to keep walking with Him, and all of life becomes one long stroll. As we sense the strength of God's everlasting arms beneath us, we can stroll through life with confidence, as long as we keep our hand in the hand of our unseen Companion. We can be confident about tomorrow if we walk with God today.
subject: Walking with God
verse_text: The eternal God is our refuge, and underneath are the everlasting arms.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/22/19:

I will sing of Your strength, in the morning I will sing of your
love.

 (Ps. 59:16) read (Ps. 59:6-16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

It's amazing to think that David wrote this song as he was being
hunted

down by men seeking to kill him! Despite his circumstances, David

remembered God's power and mercy, and singing of them encouraged

him to go on. MAY OUR GOD GIVE US A SONG TODAY THAT WILL REMIND US

OF HIS GOODNESS AND GREATNESS.

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: It's amazing to think that David wrote this song as he was being hunted down by men seeking to kill him! Despite his circumstances, David remembered God's power and mercy, and singing of them encouraged him to go on. MAY OUR GOD GIVE US A SONG TODAY THAT WILL REMIND US OF HIS GOODNESS AND GREATNESS.
original_verse_text: I will sing of Your strength, in the morning I will sing of your love.
prayer: Heavenly Father, in the midst of our trials and tribulations, we turn our eyes to You, the Almighty God who reigns supreme. Like David, may we find solace in the knowledge of Your unfailing love and unwavering protection. Strengthen our faith, that we may sing of Your power and rejoice in Your salvation, even in the darkest of hours. Lord, be our fortress and our refuge, that we may face each day with the confidence that You are our ever-present help. Amen.
reflection: It's amazing to think that David wrote this song as he was being hunted down by men seeking to kill him! Despite his circumstances, David remembered God's power and mercy, and singing of them encouraged him to go on. May our God give us a song today that will remind us of His goodness and greatness.
subject: The Power of Music
verse_text: I will sing of Your strength, in the morning I will sing of your love.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/23/19:

Truly my soul finds rest in God; my salvation comes from Him.

(Ps. 62:1)

SOMETHING TO THINK ABOUT:

We live in a noisy world Today, RIGHT? I live next to a highway

and I couldn't even guess how may trucks and cars come into

town or pass through town on this highway. But there are days

we need to close the patio door just to hear ourselves think. It is

sad but often our church sanctuaries are so noisy that it leaves

little time for quiet reflection. The Psalmist's words are still

relevant today. "Wait silently for God alone." (Ps. 62:5) The

trick today is to find that place of silence. WHY? BECAUSE WE

NEED SILENCE TO HEAR GOD'S VOICE, SO WE NEED TO TURN DOWN

THE WORLD'S VOLUME.

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: We live in a noisy world Today, RIGHT? I live next to a highway and I couldn't even guess how may trucks and cars come into town or pass through town on this highway. But there are days we need to close the patio door just to hear ourselves think. It is sad but often our church sanctuaries are so noisy that it leaves little time for quiet reflection. The Psalmist's words are still relevant today.  "Wait silently for God alone." (Psalm 62:5) The trick today is to find that place of silence. WHY? BECAUSE WE NEED SILENCE TO HEAR GOD'S VOICE, SO WE NEED TO TURN DOWN THE WORLD'S VOLUME.
original_verse_text: Truly my soul finds rest in God; my salvation comes from Him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, in the midst of the constant noise and busyness of our world, we come before You seeking the quiet refuge of Your presence. Help us to silence the distractions and still our hearts, that we may wait silently and attentively for Your voice to speak to us. May we find our true rest and salvation in You alone, the Rock who sustains us. Guide us to that place of solitude where we can hear Your whispers and be renewed by Your Spirit. Amen.
reflection: We live in a noisy world. Today, right? I live next to a highway, and I couldn't even guess how many trucks and cars come into town or pass through town on this highway. But there are days we need to close the patio door just to hear ourselves think. It is sad, but often our church sanctuaries are so noisy that it leaves little time for quiet reflection. The Psalmist's words are still relevant today: “Wait silently for God alone.” (Psalm 62:5) The trick today is to find that place of silence. Why? Because we need silence to hear God's voice, so we need to turn down the world's volume.
subject: The Beauty of Silence
verse_text: Truly my soul finds rest in God; my salvation comes from Him.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/24/19: (read Ps. 63)

You, God, are my God, earnestly I seek You; I thirst for You, my
whole being longs for You, in a dry and parched land where there is no
water. (Ps. 63:1)

THOUGHT ON THIS SUBJECT:

Some people openly declare that they don't want to go to heaven.
Most people, however, say they hope to go to heaven when they die,
BUT, I've often wondered what makes them think they would be happy
there. Now David makes no reference in Psalm 63 to spending eternity
with God, there is no doubt about his deep longing for the Lord. Now
to me, that raises some heart-searching questions: How passionately do
we seek fellowship with God? How much time do we spend reading His
Word, praying, and worshiping? How earnestly do we want to please Him?
Does our soul thirst for Him and our heart long for Him? IF SO, we can
say with David, "My soul follows close behind You" (v. 8 NKJV).

ONE OF LIFE'S GREATEST JOYS IS THE SURE HOPE OF HEAVEN.

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: Some people openly declare that they don't want to go to heaven. Most people, however, say they hope to go to heaven when they die, BUT, I've often wondered what makes them think they would be happy there. Now David makes no reference in Psalm 63 to spending eternity with God, there is no doubt about his deep longing for the Lord. Now to me, that raises some heart-searching questions: How passionately do we seek fellowship with God? How much time do we spend reading His Word, praying, and worshiping? How earnestly do we want to please Him? Does our soul thirst for Him and our heart long for Him? IF SO, we can say with David, "My soul follows close behind You" (v. 8 NKJV). ONE OF LIFE'S GREATEST JOYS IS THE SURE HOPE OF HEAVEN
original_verse_text: You, God, are my God, earnestly I seek You; I thirst for You, my whole being longs for You, in a dry and parched land where there is no water.
prayer: Heavenly Father, our souls long for You and our hearts thirst for Your presence. Like David, we desire to know You more deeply and to walk closely with You. May our love for You burn brightly, and may we find our greatest joy in the hope of eternal fellowship with You in heaven. We commit ourselves to seeking You, reading Your Word, and living to please You. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Some people openly declare that they don't want to go to heaven. Most people, however, say they hope to go to heaven when they die, BUT, I've often wondered what makes them think they would be happy there. Now David makes no reference in Psalm 63 to spending eternity with God, there is no doubt about his deep longing for the Lord. Now to me, that raises some heart-searching questions: How passionately do we seek fellowship with God? How much time do we spend reading His Word, praying, and worshiping? How earnestly do we want to please Him? Does our soul thirst for Him and our heart long for Him? IF SO, we can say with David, “My soul follows close behind You” (v. 8 NKJV). ONE OF LIFE'S GREATEST JOYS IS THE SURE HOPE OF HEAVEN
subject: Preparing for Heaven
verse_text: You, God, are my God, earnestly I seek You; I thirst for You, my whole being longs for You, in a dry and parched land where there is no water.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/25/19

Praise be to God, who has not rejected my prayer or 

withheld His love from me! (Ps. 66:20)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When we suffer pain or loss, we sometimes ask the question,

"If the Lord is with us, why has all this happened?" While

the Bible tells us the future of human history, it supplies no

specific explanation of the events that take place daily in our

lives. Sometimes when tragedy strikes we understand very little,

AND are unable to fathom the mystery of disease or accidents.

Are you going through circumstances you don't understand.

CONTINUE TO TRUST HIS WISDOM AND GOODNESS, REMEMBER HE

IS OUR QUARTERBACK.

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: When we suffer pain or loss, we sometimes ask the question, "If the Lord is with us, why has all this happened?" While the Bible tells us the future of human history, it supplies no specific explanation of the events that take place daily in our lives. Sometimes when tragedy strikes we understand very little, AND are unable to fathom the mystery of disease or accidents. Are you going through circumstances you don't understand. CONTINUE TO TRUST HIS WISDOM AND GOODNESS, REMEMBER HE IS OUR QUARTERBACK.
original_verse_text: Praise be to God, who has not rejected my prayer or withheld His love from me!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the mystery of the trials and tribulations we face in this life. Though we may not always understand the reasons behind the pain and loss we experience, we trust in Your wisdom and goodness. Lord, help us to remember that You are our Shepherd, guiding us through the ups and downs of our journey. Give us the strength to continue to put our faith in You, even when the path ahead is unclear. We give thanks that You are a God who does not forsake us, but remains faithful and true. Amen.
reflection: When we suffer pain or loss, we sometimes ask the question, “If the Lord is with us, why has all this happened?” While the Bible tells us the future of human history, it supplies no specific explanation of the events that take place daily in our lives. Sometimes when tragedy strikes, we understand very little and are unable to fathom the mystery of disease or accidents. Are you going through circumstances you don't understand? Continue to trust His wisdom and goodness. Remember, He is our guide.
subject: The Mystery of Tragedy
verse_text: Praise be to God, who has not rejected my prayer or withheld His love from me!

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/26/19:

Let heaven and earth praise Him, the seas and all that move in them.
(Ps. 69:34)

SOMETHING TO THINK ABOUT:

As we grow to understand the wonder of creation, it must always point
us to the Creator--Himself and call us to worship Him. as the psalmist
said, "let heaven and earth praise Him, the seas ad all that move in
them" (vs. 69:34). If creation itself give praise

to the Creator, we can and certainly should join the chorus.

WHAT A WONDERFUL GOD WE SERVE.

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: As we grow to understand the wonder of creation, it must always point us to the Creator--Himself and call us to worship Him. as the psalmist said, "let heaven and earth praise Him, the seas ad all that move in them" (vs. 69:34). If creation itself give praise to the Creator, we can and certainly should join the chorus. WHAT A WONDERFUL GOD WE SERVE.
original_verse_text: Let heaven and earth praise Him, the seas and all that move in them.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your magnificent creation, which testifies to Your power, wisdom, and glory. As the heavens and the earth, the seas and all that move within them, praise and worship You, we humbly join their chorus, lifting our voices to glorify Your holy name. May our lives be a living sacrifice of worship, for You alone are worthy of all praise. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: As we grow to understand the wonder of creation, it must always point us to the Creator—Himself and call us to worship Him. As the psalmist said, “Let heaven and earth praise Him, the seas and all that move in them” (Ps. 69:34). If creation itself gives praise to the Creator, we can and certainly should join the chorus. WHAT A WONDERFUL GOD WE SERVE.
subject: The Other Eighty Percent
verse_text: Let heaven and earth praise Him, the seas and all that move in them.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/27/19:

From birth I have relied on You, You brought me forth from my
mothers' womb.I will ever praise You. (Ps. 71:6)

FOOD FOR THOUGHT:

How ironic! When we are young, we can't wait to grow up! When we
are old we look back longingly to former years. God intends that we
joyfully

take each season of life as it comes. He asks us to commit our way to
Him

and accept what He allows of struggle and what He provides of
strength.

Now the question is, are you in life's spring time? Trust God's
timing to

fulfil your dreams. Are you in life's summer or autumn? Face your
daily

challenges head on. AND if you feel winter's chill, concentrate on
knowing

God better. HIS PRESENCE WILL MAKE EVERY SEASON OF LIFE ONE OF
STRENGTH

AND BEAUTY.

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: How ironic! When we are young, we can't wait to grow up! When we are old we look back longingly to former years. God intends that we joyfully take each season of life as it comes. He asks us to commit our way to Him and accept what He allows of struggle and what He provides of strength. Now the question is, are you in life's spring time? Trust God's timing to fulfill your dreams. Are you in life's summer or autumn? Face your daily challenges head on. AND if you feel winter's chill, concentrate on knowing God better. HIS PRESENCE WILL MAKE EVERY SEASON OF LIFE ONE OF STRENGTH AND BEAUTY.
original_verse_text: From birth I have relied on You, You brought me forth from my mothers' womb. I will ever praise You.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for your steadfast love and faithfulness that have sustained us from our youth until this day. In every season of life, may we trust in your perfect timing and find our strength in your abiding presence. As we face the challenges and joys that come with each stage, keep us anchored in your Word and ever-growing in our knowledge of you. May our lives be a testament to your goodness and grace. Amen.
reflection: How ironic! When we are young, we can't wait to grow up! When we are old we look back longingly to former years. God intends that we joyfully take each season of life as it comes. He asks us to commit our way to Him and accept what He allows of struggle and what He provides of strength. Now the question is, are you in life's spring time? Trust God's timing to fulfill your dreams. Are you in life's summer or autumn? Face your daily challenges head on. AND if you feel winter's chill, concentrate on knowing God better. HIS PRESENCE WILL MAKE EVERY SEASON OF LIFE ONE OF STRENGTH AND BEAUTY.
subject: Life's Seasons
verse_text: From birth I have relied on You, You brought me forth from my mothers' womb. I will ever praise You.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/28/19:

But as for me, it is good to be near God. I have made the Sovereign

Lord my refuge; I will tell of all Your deeds. (Ps. 73:28)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The psalmist knew what he was running from. He had been living from

doubt and despair. But now he knew where he was going to run and why.

He sang, "It is good to be near God . I will tell of all Your
deeds"

(Ps. 73:28). He also said, "You guide me with your counsel, and
after-

ward You will take me into glory" (vs. 24). Have you figured out what

you are running from? MORE IMPORTANT, DO YOU KNOW WHAT YOU ARE

RUNNING TO.

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: The psalmist knew what he was running from. He had been living from doubt and despair. But now he knew where he was going to run and why. He sang, "It is good to be near God . I will tell of all Your deeds" (Psalm 73:28). He also said, "You guide me with your counsel, and after- ward You will take me into glory" (vs. 24). Have you figured out what you are running from? MORE IMPORTANT, DO YOU KNOW WHAT YOU ARE RUNNING TO.
original_verse_text: But as for me, it is good to be near God. I have made the Sovereign Lord my refuge; I will tell of all Your deeds.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the turmoil and doubts that can sometimes fill our hearts. Like the psalmist, we have been tempted to stray from Your path, drawn by the allure of the world. But now, we know that it is good to be near You, our refuge and strength. Guide us with Your counsel, that we may walk in Your ways and declare Your mighty deeds. May we find our true joy and purpose in drawing closer to You, for in Your presence is fullness of life. Amen.
reflection: The psalmist knew what he was running from. He had been living from doubt and despair. But now he knew where he was going to run and why. He sang, “It is good to be near God . I will tell of all Your deeds” (Psalm 73:28). He also said, “You guide me with your counsel, and after- ward You will take me into glory” (vs. 24). Have you figured out what you are running from? MORE IMPORTANT, DO YOU KNOW WHAT YOU ARE RUNNING TO.
subject: What are You Running To
verse_text: But as for me, it is good to be near God. I have made the Sovereign Lord my refuge; I will tell of all Your deeds.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/29/19:

I will remember the deeds of the Lord; yes, I will remember Your 

miracles of long ago. (Ps. 77:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

If you will read all of Ps. 77 you will see that the faith of the
psalmist

was floundering. AFTER listing his serious doubts, he asked, "Has
God

forgotten to be merciful?" (v. 9) THEN SUDDENLY he stopped and
said,

I will remember the deeds of the Lord, yes, I will remember your

miracles of long ago" (v. 11). The act of remembering obviously

revived his faith. SO why not create your own book of remembrance,

recording God's wonderful deeds? THEN READ IT OFTEN, ESPECIALLY ON

DAYS OF DOUBT.

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: If you will read all of Psalm 77 you will see that the faith of the psalmist was floundering. AFTER listing his serious doubts, he asked, "Has God forgotten to be merciful?" (v. 9) THEN SUDDENLY he stopped and said, I will remember the deeds of the Lord, yes, I will remember your miracles of long ago" (v. 11). The act of remembering obviously revived his faith. SO why not create your own book of remembrance, recording God's wonderful deeds? THEN READ IT OFTEN, ESPECIALLY ON DAYS OF DOUBT.
original_verse_text: I will remember the deeds of the Lord; yes, I will remember Your miracles of long ago.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, remembering the mighty deeds You have accomplished in our lives. When our faith wavers and doubts creep in, may we turn to the record of Your steadfast love and unwavering faithfulness. Remind us of the miracles You have performed in the past, that we may find renewed strength and trust in Your enduring presence. May we ever be mindful of Your unfailing mercies, and may our souls be revived by the recounting of Your wondrous works. Amen.
reflection: If you will read all of Psalm 77 you will see that the faith of the psalmist was floundering. AFTER listing his serious doubts, he asked, “Has God forgotten to be merciful?” (v. 9) THEN SUDDENLY he stopped and said, I will remember the deeds of the Lord, yes, I will remember your miracles of long ago“ (v. 11). The act of remembering obviously revived his faith. SO why not create your own book of remembrance, recording God's wonderful deeds? THEN READ IT OFTEN, ESPECIALLY ON DAYS OF DOUBT.
subject: Days of Doubt
verse_text: I will remember the deeds of the Lord; yes, I will remember Your miracles of long ago.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/30/19:

Fathers, don't exasperate your children; instead, bring them up in

the training and instruction of the Lord. (Eph. 6:4).

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

A man was having a little chat with his young son. He was trying

to tell him what a Christian should be like and how he should act.

When he was finished talking, his son looked at him and asked a

stunning question. The boy asked, "Daddy have I seen a Christian?"

What a telling commentary on the life of the father, and any other

father. How would we feel if our children were to ask us this same

question. Psalm 78 gives us some help in making sure that doesn't

happen. It sets forth a pattern for parenting. Be sure to read the
first

7 verses of Ps. 78. Here is a point to remember: CHILDREN MAY CLOSE

THEIR EARS TO ADVICE, BUT THEY KEEP THEIR EYES OPEN TO EXAMPLE.

PASTOR AL.
original_reflection_text: A man was having a little chat with his young son. He was trying to tell him what a Christian should be like and how he should act. When he was finished talking, his son looked at him and asked a stunning question. The boy asked, "Daddy have I seen a Christian?" What a telling commentary on the life of the father, and any other father. How would we feel if our children were to ask us this same question. Psalm 78 gives us some help in making sure that doesn't happen. It sets forth a pattern for parenting. Be sure to read the first 7 verses of Psalm 78. Here is a point to remember: CHILDREN MAY CLOSE THEIR EARS TO ADVICE, BUT THEY KEEP THEIR EYES OPEN TO EXAMPLE.
original_verse_text: Fathers, don't exasperate your children; instead, bring them up in the training and instruction of the Lord.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking to be the kind of parents that reflect Your love and grace. Help us to live out our faith in a way that our children can see and understand. May we teach them diligently about Your mighty works and the wonders You have done, so that they may put their trust in You and not forget Your deeds, but keep Your commandments. Lord, guide us to be examples of Your steadfast love, that our children may see Christ in us. Amen.
reflection: A man was having a little chat with his young son. He was trying to tell him what a Christian should be like and how he should act. When he was finished talking, his son looked at him and asked a stunning question. The boy asked, “Daddy have I seen a Christian?” What a telling commentary on the life of the father, and any other father. How would we feel if our children were to ask us this same question. Psalm 78 gives us some help in making sure that doesn't happen. It sets forth a pattern for parenting. Be sure to read the first 7 verses of Psalm 78. Here is a point to remember: CHILDREN MAY CLOSE THEIR EARS TO ADVICE, BUT THEY KEEP THEIR EYES OPEN TO EXAMPLE.
subject: A Pattern for Parents
verse_text: Fathers, don't exasperate your children; instead, bring them up in the training and instruction of the Lord.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/31/19:

In your distress you called and I rescued you,

I answered you out of a thundercloud; I tested

you at the waters of Meribah. (Ps. 81:7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Are you in trouble? Cry out to God in your sorrow

and distress. You may not hear the thunder roll, but

if you trust in God He will speak comforting words

to your heart through His Word and deliver you from

your fears. THOSE WHO TRUST IN GOD FIND COMFORT IN

HIS POWER.

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: Are you in trouble? Cry out to God in your sorrow and distress. You may not hear the thunder roll, but if you trust in God He will speak comforting words to your heart through His Word and deliver you from your fears. THOSE WHO TRUST IN GOD FIND COMFORT IN HIS POWER.
original_verse_text: In your distress you called and I rescued you, I answered you out of a thundercloud; I tested you at the waters of Meribah.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in our times of trouble, crying out for Your help and deliverance. You have promised to answer us and speak words of comfort when we call upon Your name. Lord, we trust in Your power to rescue us from our fears and distresses. Fill our hearts with the assurance of Your presence, that we may find rest and peace in You. Amen.
reflection: Are you in trouble? Cry out to God in your sorrow and distress. You may not hear the thunder roll, but if you trust in God, He will speak comforting words to your heart through His Word and deliver you from your fears. Those who trust in God find comfort in His power.
subject: When God Thunders
verse_text: In your distress you called and I rescued you, I answered you out of a thundercloud; I tested you at the waters of Meribah.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 8/1/31:

"Whoever welcomes one of these little children in My

name welcomes Me; and whoever welcomes Me does

not welcome Me but the One who sent Me." (Mk. 9:37)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The hurting children of the world need two things: First,

the gospel of Jesus, who told us that in helping them we

would be doing His work (Mk. 9:37). And second, they

need the hope that comes from someone who cares enough

to feed, cloth, and shelter them. What can your family do

to help the children? GIVE HOPE TO A CHILD, SHARE THE LOVE

OF CHRIST.

PASTOR AL
original_reflection_text: The hurting children of the world need two things: First, the gospel of Jesus, who told us that in helping them we would be doing His work (Mark 9:37). And second, they need the hope that comes from someone who cares enough to feed, cloth, and shelter them. What can your family do to help the children? GIVE HOPE TO A CHILD, SHARE THE LOVE OF CHRIST.
original_verse_text: "Whoever welcomes one of these little children in My name welcomes Me; and whoever welcomes Me does not welcome Me but the One who sent Me."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts burdened for the hurting children of the world. May we heed Your call to welcome them in Your name, for in doing so, we welcome You (Mark 9:37). Grant us the compassion and resources to provide for their physical needs, but most importantly, to share the hope and love found in the gospel of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Use us as instruments to bring Your light into the darkness they face. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: The hurting children of the world need two things: First, the gospel of Jesus, who told us that in helping them we would be doing His work (Mark 9:37). And second, they need the hope that comes from someone who cares enough to feed, clothe, and shelter them. What can your family do to help the children? Give hope to a child, share the love of Christ.
subject: Help the Children
verse_text: “Whoever welcomes one of these little children in My name welcomes Me; and whoever welcomes Me does not welcome Me but the One who sent Me.”
